member.name: T:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken
member.summary: Type-safe session identifier with metadata. Sessions are containers for related windows sharing state. Implements IToken<SessionToken> for polymorphic token operations. Contains ScopeTag for session categorization.

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.Name
member.summary: Session name (for debugging/display)

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.Tag
member.summary: Scope tag defining the session category and context

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.ParentId
member.summary: Parent session token ID (if this is a child session)

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.CreatedAt
member.summary: Creation timestamp

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.State
member.summary: Session lifecycle state

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.Color
member.summary: Token status color derived from session state. Active = Green, Closing = Yellow, Closed = Red.

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the identifier is empty.

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.Create(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Guid})
member.summary: Create a new session token

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.FromGuid(System.Guid)
member.summary: Create from existing Guid (for migration/compatibility). Creates a basic session with no name. Required by IToken<SessionToken> interface.

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.FromGuid(System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Guid})
member.summary: Create from existing Guid with optional name and tag.

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.op_Implicit(Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken)~System.Guid
member.summary: Implicit conversion to Guid (returns Id). Allows using SessionToken wherever Guid is expected.

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.op_Implicit(System.Guid)~Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken
member.summary: Implicit conversion from Guid. Creates a basic session with no name. For full control, use FromGuid overload.

member.summary: Update state

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.WithName(System.String)
member.summary: Update name

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.WithTag(System.String)
member.summary: Update tag

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.WithParentId(System.Nullable{System.Guid})
member.summary: Update parent ID

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.IsActive
member.summary: Whether session is active

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.IsClosing
member.summary: Whether session is closing

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.IsClosed
member.summary: Whether session is closed

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.HasParent
member.summary: Whether this is a child session

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current session, including its identifier, name, tag, and state.
member.remarks: The returned string includes the first eight characters of the session's unique identifier, followed by the name and tag if available, and the current state in brackets. This method is useful for debugging and monitoring session information.
member.returns: A string containing a summary of the session's ID, name, tag, and state. The format is suitable for logging or display purposes.

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.GetHashCode
member.summary: Serves as the default hash function for the current object.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer hash code representing the current object.

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current session token.
member.remarks: This method supports comparison with both instances and values. For other types, the method returns false.
member.param: The object to compare with the current session token. Can be a or a .
member.returns: true if the specified object is equal to the current session token; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.Equals(Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken,Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken)
member.summary: Determines whether two specified instances are equal.
member.remarks: Equality is determined by comparing the identifiers of the two instances. This method supports comparison when either or both arguments are null.
member.returns: true if both and are null, or if both are non-null and have the same identifier; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.GetHashCode(Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken)
member.summary: Returns a hash code for the specified instance.
member.param: The object for which to compute the hash code. Cannot be null.
member.returns: An integer hash code representing the specified .

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.Equals(Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken)
member.summary: Determines whether the current SessionToken instance is equal to the specified SessionToken.
member.param: The SessionToken to compare with the current instance. Can be null.
member.returns: true if the specified SessionToken is not null and has the same Id as the current instance; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken.op_Equality(Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken,Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.SessionToken)
member.summary: Determines whether two instances are equal.
member.remarks: Equality is determined by comparing the values of the two instances. If both operands are null, the result is true.
member.returns: true if the specified instances are equal; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken
member.summary: Type-safe window identifier with metadata. Replaces Guid windowId for better type safety, debugging, and LINQ queries. Implements IToken<WindowToken> for polymorphic token operations.

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken.Type
member.summary: Type of window (Window, Dialog, Shell)

member.summary: Parent window ID (if child window)

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken.SessionId
member.summary: Session ID (if in session)

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken.CreatedAt
member.summary: Creation timestamp

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken.Color
member.summary: Token status color representing lifecycle state. Green = Open, Yellow = Closing, Red = Closed/Faulted.

member.name: P:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current identifier is empty.

member.summary: Implicit conversion from Guid. Creates a basic Window token. For full control, use FromGuid overload.

member.summary: Compares this token's Id with another Guid.

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken.Equals(Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken)
member.summary: Determines whether the current WindowToken instance is equal to the specified WindowToken.
member.param: The WindowToken to compare with the current instance. Can be null.
member.returns: true if the specified WindowToken is not null and has the same Id as the current instance; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken.op_Equality(Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken,Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken)
member.summary: Determines whether two instances are equal.
member.remarks: Equality is determined by comparing the values of the two instances. If both operands are null, the result is true.
member.returns: true if the specified instances are equal; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken.op_Inequality(Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken,Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken)
member.summary: Determines whether two WindowToken instances are not equal.
member.remarks: This operator performs a value-based comparison using the Equals method. If both operands are null, they are considered equal.
member.returns: true if the specified WindowToken instances are not equal; otherwise, false.
